pros: The company has a wonderful mission and you get to interact with so many different people.
cons: Workload was massive and I didn’t feel valued

pros: Admissions team. I was able to spend more time with my patients because they had an admissions team in place and therefore regular and supervisory visits were less rushed allowing for higher quality care
cons: Some upper management (mostly Human Resources) where unable to understand how difficult hospice cases, particularly with children, affects the care team. Felt a lack of support and empathy.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Jacksonville, NC
pros: Pay is decent for the area, good mileage pay at 0.50 per mile. Love the job and helping my patients. They have home health or hospice; nurses do not cross between types of patients. You do either home health or hospice. Everybody is great to work with on my side of the company.
cons: Company seems disorganized. You have paid Holidays off but they take your PTO which doesn't make sense. Home health nurses take a lot of call.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Wilmington, NC
cons: No room for growth within the company

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Wilmington, NC
pros: Room for growth and flexible schedule
cons: Very large overnight on call territory and some places were very rural and felt incredibly dangerous at 3 AM

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Wilmington, NC
cons: None that I can think of that is really important.

pros: Some of my coworkers were helpful
cons: Management is terrible and flip flops. Not consistent.

pros: There are remarkable people who work for this agency, those who talents and dedication to the hospice movement are to be commended.
cons: Complete lack of appreciation for a job well done.  Management asks for ideas and they are never acknowledged or considered.  Unfortunately the organization lacks any natural born leaders.  As a result, these deficits are masked by a feeling of superiority which is a big turnoff.  I have been there many years and have never held any conversation with upper management.  Funny thing, this organization believes that the higher you go, the fewer hours you have to work.  Leadership waltzes in when they want, leave when they want and consider this a privilege of a "salaried" employee.  The real workers are the hourly employees who punch a clock and witness everyday the inadequacies of the higher ups and the real contributors.  Despite the noble cause, it is difficult to stomach the complete lack of interest, compassion, work ethic, and inspiration from the Leadership team.  Really, it is a joke and no secret in the community.

job_title: Staff Chaplain in Myrtle Beach, SC
pros: Excellent benefits, work from home office to call families and schedule visits. Interdisciplinary team Concept strong. Overall joy of caring for patients and families as the patient transitions to end of life.
cons: Long hours and much travel time on the road. My territory was huge where it was a good 2 hour drive end to end. So if I received an emergency call at the other end of where I was it would take me too long to arrive and offer comfort.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Wilmington, NC
pros: Coworkers are always willing to help out with the workload and answer questions and you don't know the answer. The RNs social workers and chaplains usually work together as a team
cons: They are not giving raises anymore. And the benefits are not nearly as good as they were. They hire you for a position  then send you to do another job title if the census falls

job_title: RN Case Manager in Wilmington, NC
pros: The company truly cares about what they do and tries to have the right resources to do it.  Gwen cares about her employees and advocates for them as well.  Great work life balance.
cons: Micromanagement.  Constantly trying to manipulate employees rather than being straight forward about goals and expectations.

pros: Staff support and work environment very good. Flexible scheduling, supportive management. Overall, this company really has the heart of hospice.
cons: The hardest part of hospice work is often families; SW and chaplaincy staffing could be improved for better availability.

pros: The mission of the organization is truly to help people. Management is supportive.
cons: It is a salary position and with all the overtime you put in, you’re working for free quite a bit.

review_title: Great nurses in the field, but terrible upper management.
job_title: RN Case Manager in Wilmington, NC
pros: Nurses in the field are amazing!
cons: Upper management is very poor. Not supportive of nurses out in the field. This place has a revolving door. I would never recommend working here too hey friend. I would be doing them a grave disservice.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Wilmington, NC
pros: Caring for patients, helping their families cope with illness
cons: Emotionally draining at times in dealing with dying patients

pros: time off, good people for the most part
cons: unrealistic expectations, long hours, limited growth

pros: Sometimes people had birthdays and we had cake
cons: Don’t worry if you are using this to be employed.  They won’t be hiring likely the doors will be closing soon.

pros: Hospice should be a place where you can feel good about what you are doing.
cons: Management is terrible, even after firing the lying one in marketing, and the nasty one in finance.
